alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 9:09PM AKST until December 15 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions due to blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile with whiteout conditions possible at times. * WHERE...Whittier. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and result in significant drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly winds in and around Whittier continue to lift easily transportable snow already on the ground leading to ground blizzard conditions. Winds are expected to diminish after midnight tonight.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
